items.name: Component_MoveAnimation
items.content:
# ===================================================================
#
#   Script: Component_MoveAnimation
#
#   $$COPYRIGHT$$
#
# ===================================================================
class Component_MoveAnimation extends gs.Component_Animation
    ###*
    * Executes a move-animation on a game-object.
    *
    * @module gs
    * @class Component_MoveAnimation
    * @extends gs.Component_Animation
    * @memberof gs
    * @constructor
    ###
    constructor: (data) ->
        super
        
        ###*
        * The easing-object used for the animation.
        * @property easing
        * @type gs.Easing
        ###
        @easing = new gs.Easing(null, data?.easing)
        
        ###*
        * The move-animation type (move-in, move-out, etc.).
        * @property animationType
        * @type gs.MoveAnimationType
        ###
        @animationType = data?.animationType || 0
     
    ###*
    * Serializes the move-animation into a data-bundle.
    *
    * @method toDataBundle
    ###      
    toDataBundle: ->
        easing: @easing,
        animationType: @animationType
     
    ###*
    * Updates the move-animation.
    *
    * @method update
    ###      
    update: ->
        super()
        if not @easing.isRunning then return
        
        @easing.updatePosition()
        
        @updateCoordinates()
            
        if not @easing.isRunning
            if not @easing.isEndless
                @object.dstRect.x = Math.round(@object.dstRect.x)
                @object.dstRect.y = Math.round(@object.dstRect.y)
            @callback?(@object, this)
     
    ###*
    * Updates the game object's coordinates depending on animation type.
    *
    * @method updateCoordinates
    * @protected
    ###     
    updateCoordinates: ->
        switch @animationType
            when 0
                @object.offset.x = Math.floor(@easing.x)
                @object.offset.y = Math.floor(@easing.y)
            when 1
                @object.dstRect.x = Math.floor(@easing.x)
                @object.dstRect.y = Math.floor(@easing.y)
            when 2
                @object.visual.scroll.x = Math.round(@easing.x)
                @object.visual.scroll.y = Math.round(@easing.y)
                
    ###*
    * Scrolls the game object's content with a specified speed if supported.
    *
    * @method scroll
    * @param {number} speedX The speed on x-axis in pixels per frame.
    * @param {number} speedY The speed on y-axis in pixels per frame.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type used for the animation.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback-function called when the animation is finished.
    ###  
    scroll: (speedX, speedY, duration, easingType, callback) ->
        @move(speedX, speedY, duration, easingType, callback)
        @animationType = 2
        
    ###*
    * Scrolls the game object to a specified position.
    *
    * @method scrollTo
    * @param {number} x The x-coordinate of the position.
    * @param {number} y The y-coordinate of the position.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback-function called when the animation is finished.
    ###      
    scrollTo: (x, y, duration, easingType, callback) ->
        @animationType = 2
        @callback = callback
        if @object.visual.scroll.x == x and @object.visual.scroll.y == y then return
        
        @easing.type = easingType || gs.Easings.EASE_LINEAR[gs.EasingTypes.EASE_IN]
        if duration == 0 or @isInstantSkip()
            @object.visual.scroll.x = x
            @object.visual.scroll.y = y
            @callback?(@object, this)
        else
            @easing.start(@object.visual.scroll.x, @object.visual.scroll.y, x, y, duration)
            @targetX = x
            @targetY = y
        
    ###*
    * Moves the game object with a specified speed.
    *
    * @method move
    * @param {number} speedX The speed on x-axis in pixels per frame.
    * @param {number} speedY The speed on y-axis in pixels per frame.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type used for the animation.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback-function called when the animation is finished.
    ###        
    move: (speedX, speedY, duration, easingType, callback) ->
        @animationType = 1
        @targetX = duration * speedX
        @targetY = duration * speedY
        @callback = callback
        
        @easing.type = easingType || gs.Easings.EASE_LINEAR[gs.EasingTypes.EASE_IN]
        if duration == 0 or @isInstantSkip()
            @easing.startEndless(speedX, speedY)
        else
            @easing.start(@object.dstRect.x, @object.dstRect.y, @targetX, @targetY, duration)
    
    ###*
    * Moves the game object to a specified position.
    *
    * @method moveTo
    * @param {number} x The x-coordinate of the position.
    * @param {number} y The y-coordinate of the position.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback-function called when the animation is finished.
    ###      
    moveTo: (x, y, duration, easingType, callback) ->
        @animationType = 1
        @callback = callback
        if @object.dstRect.x == x and @object.dstRect.y == y then return
        
        @easing.type = easingType || gs.Easings.EASE_LINEAR[gs.EasingTypes.EASE_IN]
        if duration == 0 or @isInstantSkip()
            @easing.x = x
            @easing.y = y
            @updateCoordinates()
        else
            @easing.start(@object.dstRect.x, @object.dstRect.y, x, y, duration)
            @targetX = x
            @targetY = y
    
    ###*
    * Lets a game object appear on screen from left, top, right or bottom using 
    * a move-animation
    *
    * @method moveIn
    * @param {number} x The x-coordinate of the target-position.
    * @param {number} y The y-coordinate of the target-position.
    * @param {number} type The movement-direction from where the game object should move-in.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback-function called when the animation is finished. 
    ###         
    moveIn: (x, y, type, duration, easing, callback) ->
        @animationType = 0
        @object.offset.x = 0
        @object.offset.y = 0
        
        if duration == 0 or @isInstantSkip()
            @object.update()
            return callback?(@object, this)
        
        @easing.type = easing
        @callback = callback
        
        rect = if @object.angle? then @object.dstRect.rotate(@object.angle) else @object.dstRect
        width = rect.width * @object.zoom.x
        height = rect.height * @object.zoom.y
        x = @object.dstRect.x - (width-rect.width) * @object.anchor.x
        y = @object.dstRect.y - (height-rect.height) * @object.anchor.y
        
        switch type
            when 0 # Left
                @object.offset.y = 0
                @object.offset.x = -(x+width+@object.origin.x)
            when 1 # Top
                @object.offset.y = -(y+height+@object.origin.y)
                @object.offset.x = 0
            when 2 # Right
                @object.offset.x = (@object.viewport||Graphics.viewport).rect.width - x
                @object.offset.y = 0
            when 3 # Bottom
                @object.offset.x = 0
                @object.offset.y = (@object.viewport||Graphics.viewport).rect.height - y

        @object.update()
        @easing.start(@object.offset.x, @object.offset.y, 0, 0, duration)
       
    ###*
    * Lets a game object disappear from screen to the left, top, right or bottom using 
    * a move-animation
    *
    * @method moveOut
    * @param {number} type The movement-direction in which the game object should move-out.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback-function called when the animation is finished. 
    ###    
    moveOut: (type, duration, easing, callback) ->
        #if duration == 0 or @isInstantSkip()
        #    return callback?(@object, this)
            
        @animationType = 0
        @easing.type = easing
        @callback = callback
        
        
            
        x = 0
        y = 0
        viewport = Graphics.viewport
        
        
        rect = if @object.angle? then @object.dstRect.rotate(@object.angle) else @object.dstRect
        width = rect.width * @object.zoom.x
        height = rect.height * @object.zoom.y
        x = @object.dstRect.x - (width-rect.width) * @object.anchor.x
        y = @object.dstRect.y - (height-rect.height) * @object.anchor.y
        
        switch type
            when 0 # Left
                x = -(@object.origin.x+x+width)
                y = 0
            when 1 # Top
                y = -(@object.origin.y+y+height)
                x = 0
            when 2 # Right
                x = (@object.viewport||Graphics.viewport).rect.width
                y = 0 
            when 3 # Bottom
                y = (@object.viewport||Graphics.viewport).rect.height
                x = 0
                
        if duration == 0 or @isInstantSkip()
            @object.offset.x = x
            @object.offset.y = y
            @callback?(@object, this)
        else
            @easing.start(@object.offset.x, @object.offset.y, x, y, duration)
        
gs.Component_MoveAnimation = Component_MoveAnimation
